alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:29PM CDT until June 08 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR WESTERN DEAF SMITH COUNTY... At 1129 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Glenrio, or 33 miles northwest of Friona, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Simms and Bootleg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
